definitions.definition: A field of study within Christian theology which is concerned with the nature of Jesus Christ , particularly with how the divine and human are related in his person.
A particular theory or viewpoint within the field of Christology, e.g. Chalcedonian Christology, Arian Christology, etc.

main_definition: ( uncountable ) A field of study within Christian theology which is concerned with the nature of Jesus Christ , particularly with how the divine and human are related in his person.
secondary_definitions: ( countable ) A particular theory or viewpoint within the field of Christology, e.g. Chalcedonian Christology, Arian Christology, etc.
